Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • Course
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DirectlyRelatable

    public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
implements DirectlyRelatable
    This class implements the DiretlyRelayable class and creates a Course.
    Author:
    Najim Ghafourzadeh

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Course obj)
        This equals method compares two Course objects. The method returns true if all the attributes are the same, but for the exception of the CourseID attribute.
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isDirectlyRelated

        public boolean isDirectlyRelated(Course C)
        Description copied from interface: DirectlyRelatable
        This method returns true if the passed Course parameter is a pre-requisite or co-requisite of the current course object, or vise versa (hence the courses are directly related); otherwise it returns false.
        Specified by:
        isDirectlyRelated in interface DirectlyRelatable
        Parameters:
        C - Course object
        Returns:
        true or false
